citeinfo.title: BPAD_2011_11_fee
citeinfo.othercit: This table contains detailed data on parcels of protected lands in Calif. - Holdings can be aggreated to Units based on being part of a common overall name.

descript.abstract: The Bay Area Protected Areas Database (BPAD) is a subset of the California Protected Areas Database (CPAD) which contains all known protected lands in California that are owned in fee by public agencies and non-profits that hold them for open space uses. Unlike CPAD, BPAD includes Easement data for the 10 county SF Bay Area. The data has been developed over many years, beginning with initial surveys by GreenInfo Network in the 1990s. In the late 1990s, we undertook a major survey and improvement of the GIS database, and periodically updated it after that, when funding was available. The dataset was created by GreenInfo Network with support from the Bay Area Open Space Council and from a wide range of data sources, and is generally based on assesor parcel geometry unless that geometry is not available. BPAD/CPAD is a general planning purpose dataset and does not necessarily correspond exactly with individual agency/organization data. BPAD/CPAD may not be used for commercial resale or other such purposes - please read the license agreement before using BPAD/CPAD.
descript.purpose: BPAD, a subset of CPAD, is suitable for a wide range of planning, assessment, analysis and display purposes. BPAD should not be used as the basis for regulatory or other specific governmental actions.

idinfo.accconst: Available for download at the California Spatial Information Library web site
idinfo.useconst: All users must review the CPAD License Agreement before using the dataset. In general, the License Agreement allows any use except the redistribution of CPAD as part of commercial use - read the License Agreement for details. Free use of CPAD by governmental agencies, planning consultants, non-profits and other such groups is fully allowed and encouraged. Organizations seeking to use CPAD for a commercial venture must contact GreenInfo Network to discuss such uses.

cntinfo.cntinst: Email contact is required as funding does not allow for other forms of contact. Responses to inquiries may take some time.

idinfo.datacred: Bay Area Protected Areas Dataset (BPAD - www. openspacecouncil.org) California Protected Areas Dataset (CPAD - www.calands.org) - copyright 2011 GreenInfo Network
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

dataqual.complete: Data is generally complete for all of California - but some errors will exist and not all holdings will be inventoried. Data is generally current as of 2010.

procstep.procdesc: Data was obtained from contributing agencies/organizations and reprojected (if necessary) or projection defined. This includes data layers on parks and protected areas as well as county-wide parcel boundary data.

By county, each USGS 7.5 minute quad was analyzed for protected open space areas based on (1) available data, (2) parcel ownership data, if available, (3) visual reference documents such as aerial images, Google Maps, Thomas Brothers Guides, and other hardcopy maps. Once protected open space areas were identified, they were verified by one or more additional sources. Parcels encompassing the protected open space areas were then selected, using spatial selection or visually. Parcels were then verified, as possible, by ownership records. If parcels were unavailable, the boundary from the digital data source was used, or the area was digitized based on Public Land Survey (PLS) lines. All boundaries were compiled into a single polygon shapefile (the interim Holdings shapefile). Attributes were transferred from source data layers where possible.

The interim Holdings shapefile was then examined for shape conflicts, such as polygon overlaps and edge-matching, and adjusted as needed to resolve conflicts. Generally parcel boundaries were deferred to as most accurate. Where parcels conflicted (e.g., on county edges), polygons shapes were examined for consistency with other data layers and reference maps/imagery, and the more consistent parcel layer was accepted as true. Final shapes were split by county, if necessary.

Once the interim Holdings shapefile was clean and consistent internally, the attributes were examined, researched (from agency/organization information or online), and populated where possible. A separate log of owner agency/organization information was maintained in table format.
The interim Holdings shapefile with populated attributes was then reviewed and corrected for consistency in wording and spelling variations within the attributes.

Summary tables were generated from the interim Holdings shapefile, including summary lists of owner entities (Agency) and Units (see metadata for Units feature class for more on Units). Units were defined as unique combinations of ownership agency, park name, fee/easement, access, and county. The Agency table was compared to the active log, and attribute information was transferred/populated where possible. Agency and Unit unique ID numbers were sequentially assigned to individual records in each list, and interim Agency and Unit tables were created.

Interim Agency and Unit tables were joined into the interim Holdings shapefile by name, and unique ID number attributes were transferred to the shapefile. Manual corrections were made where necessary.
An interim Units shapefile was derived from the interim Holdings shapefile by dissolving polygon boundaries by Unit ID number. Multi-part polygons were permitted.

The interim Holdings shapefile, interim Units shapefile, and Agency table were all brought into a new geodatabase. Lookup tables for agency type, ownership type, access, use, cities, and counties were created. Relationships between the two feature classes (Holdings and Units) and associated tables were defined. Field aliases and domains were also defined.
Quality control was performed on the geodatabase for shape geometry, attribute consistency, relationship functionality, field domains, and field aliases.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
ID of individual parcel of land
Name of the Holding site - park name, etc.
Name of the Holding site if there is more than one name.
ID of Unit of which holding is a part. Units are made up of one or more Holdings
Overall name of holding or group of holdings
Jurisdiction level of agency
Type of ownership - Fee, Mixed, Transfer
Type of public access - open, closed, restricted
Agency that manages the land if different than owning agency
Whether holding is land or water (from NHD)
Codes for specific uses (golf, cemetery, island, etc)
County holding is within
City holding is within, if any
Agency web site in relation to holding
Classification for standard California listing of owning agencies
Full name of owning agency
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Acres generated from GIS

cntinfo.cntinst: Email contact is required due to budget limitations. Response to inquiries may be delayed.

distinfo.resdesc: Downloadable Data from the California Spatial Information Library web site (CASIL)

Review the CPAD License Agreement for details.

lineage.Process:
CalculateField CPAD171_Holdings HOLDING_ID autoIncrement( 78281) PYTHON_9.3 "rec=0
def autoIncrement(curr_max):
 global rec
 pStart = curr_max+1 #adjust start value, if req'd 
 pInterval = 1 #adjust interval value, if req'd
 if (rec == 0): 
 rec = pStart 
 else: 
 rec = rec + pInterval 
 return rec
"

CalculateField CPAD171_Holdings HOLDING_ID autoIncrement( 78296) PYTHON_9.3 "rec=0
def autoIncrement(curr_max):
 global rec
 pStart = curr_max+1 #adjust start value, if req'd 
 pInterval = 1 #adjust interval value, if req'd
 if (rec == 0): 
 rec = pStart 
 else: 
 rec = rec + pInterval 
 return rec
"

CalculateField CPAD171_Holdings HOLDING_ID autoIncrement( 78303) PYTHON_9.3 "rec=0
def autoIncrement(curr_max):
 global rec
 pStart = curr_max+1 #adjust start value, if req'd 
 pInterval = 1 #adjust interval value, if req'd
 if (rec == 0): 
 rec = pStart 
 else: 
 rec = rec + pInterval 
 return rec
"
CalculateField "CPAD171_Holdings SCCOSA" UNIT_NAME "Sierra Vista Open Space Preserve" VB #
CalculateField "CPAD171_Holdings SCCOSA" UNIT_NAME "Upper Uvas Creek Open Space Preserve" VB #
CalculateField "CPAD171_Holdings SCCOSA" UNIT_NAME "Coyote Valley Open Space Preserve" VB #
CalculateField "CPAD171_Holdings SCCOSA" UNIT_NAME "Diablo Foothills Open Space Preserve" VB #

CalculateField CPAD171_Holdings HOLDING_ID autoIncrement( 78309) PYTHON_9.3 "rec=0
def autoIncrement(curr_max):
 global rec
 pStart = curr_max+1 #adjust start value, if req'd 
 pInterval = 1 #adjust interval value, if req'd
 if (rec == 0): 
 rec = pStart 
 else: 
 rec = rec + pInterval 
 return rec
"

CalculateField CPAD171_Holdings HOLDING_ID autoIncrement( 78313) PYTHON_9.3 "rec=0
def autoIncrement(curr_max):
 global rec
 pStart = curr_max+1 #adjust start value, if req'd 
 pInterval = 1 #adjust interval value, if req'd
 if (rec == 0): 
 rec = pStart 
 else: 
 rec = rec + pInterval 
 return rec
"
CalculateField BPAD_2011_11_fee MNG_AGNCY "The Nature Conservancy" VB #
CalculateField BPAD_2011_11_fee MNG_AGNCY "Land Trust of Santa Cruz County" VB #
CalculateField BPAD_2011_11_fee MNG_AGNCY "Midpeninsula Regional Open Space District" VB #
